summary: This document is a chain of emails from June-July 2019 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and FBI personnel regarding the scanning of evidence boxes from two FBI case files (72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062) related to the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss logistics, deadlines, and the discovery process.

persons.name: Rossmiller
persons.context: Identified as a prosecutor working on the investigation in the Southern District of New York, providing contact information and coordinating the evidence scanning process.

persons.name: SSA Watson
persons.context: An FBI agent from Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking in New York providing tracking information for the shipment of evidence boxes.

connections.description: Working together on the logistics of scanning evidence from the Epstein investigation, with Rossmiller from the U.S. Attorney's Office and Watson from the FBI.

events.title: Evidence Boxes Shipped
events.description: Approximately 23 boxes of evidence from two FBI case files related to Epstein were shipped via FedEx from New York to Virginia for scanning.

events.title: Inventory and Scanning Completion
events.description: FBI personnel completed inventorying 22 boxes of evidence and released them to DocLab for scanning, aiming to meet a deadline for discovery.

events.title: Prior Scanning by Miami Field Office
events.description: Mention that the Miami Field Office had requested scanning of some of the evidence boxes back in 2013, but the current team prefers a complete new scan for discovery purposes.

keyFacts: The evidence being processed consists of approximately 23 boxes from two specific FBI case files: 72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062.
The scanning in July 2019 was for discovery purposes in an ongoing investigation, indicating active legal proceedings at that time.
There is mention of prior scanning efforts by the Miami Field Office in 2013, suggesting a longer investigative timeline.
The correspondence highlights coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and multiple FBI units (NY field office and an IMD unit) on evidence handling.
One box of media (tapes/discs) categorized as evidence was noted as still needing to be sent to a vendor for conversion to viewable electronic versions.
